intro: Myrtoleucodendron calothamnoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myrtle, is a flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia. Myrtoleucodendron calothamnoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local cultures.
